intro: Melanoseris qinghaica, commonly known as the Qinghai melanoseris, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai province in China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. This species is adapted to the high-altitude environment and is often found in alpine meadows.
